intro: Centaurea indistincta, commonly known as the narrowleaf cornflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are blue to violet in color, often with a yellow center, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Centaurea indistincta is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils.
